column2: WV DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: West Virginia

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.
column6: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.
column8: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.

column2: 2. Aggressive driving includes:
column4: quick lane changes without a signal.
column8: All of the above.
column10: yelling, honking, gesturing at other drivers.

column2: 3. Regulation signs normally are:
column4: blue rectangles.
column8: white triangles.

column2: 4. If your turn signals fail, you should use _____ to indicate your intention to turn.
column4: your emergency flashers
column8: hand signals

column2: 5. This sign means:
column4: Shopping centre ahead.
column6: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.
column8: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.
column10: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.

column2: 6. This sign means:
column4: Divided highway ends.
column8: Keep to the left.
column10: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.

column2: 7. When you drive near parks and playgrounds, you should expect children:
column4: to know when it is safe to cross.
column6: not to cross unless they are with an adult.
column8: to suddenly run into the street.
column10: to stop at the curb before crossing the street.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column4: Stop sign ahead
column6: Keep to the side indicated by the arrow
column8: Low shoulder

column2: 9. When changing lanes, you should:
column4: check your mirrors, signal and change lanes.
column6: signal, change lanes and check your mirrors.
column8: signal, check your mirrors and blind spot in the direction you plan to move, then change lanes.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column4: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles
column6: Yield to motorcyles, but not to bicycles
column8: Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic

column2: 11. Select the most effective safety restraint(s) in a traffic crash.
column4: A combination of lap/shoulder belt and air bag.
column8: Lap and shoulder belt only

column2: 12. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column8: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.
column10: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.

column2: 13. A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
column4: must enter the roadway immediately.
column8: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.
column10: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.

column2: 14. Pedestrians must:
column4: All the above.
column8: look in both directions before crossing the street.

column2: 15. One broken line indicates:
column4: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.
column6: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.
column8: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.

column2: 16. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a bridge ahead, wide enough to accommodate two lanes of traffic, but with very little clearance.
column8: a dip in the road. Drivers should be ready to stop if the dip is filled with water.

column2: 17. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: always park on the left side of the roadway.
column6: move as far away from traffic as possible.
column8: pull as far away from the roadside shoulder as possible.

column2: 18. Which of the following may result in an arrest for driving under the influence of intoxicants (DUII)?
column4: A controlled substance, such as prescription medicines or illegal drugs.
column8: An inhalant, such as glue or paint.

column2: 19. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.
column6: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.
column8: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.

column2: 20. Alcohol causes:
column4: poor judgment.
column8: loss of concentration.

column2: 21. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column4: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.
column8: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.

column2: 22. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column4: No, never.
column8: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.
column10: Yes, but only if oncoming vehicles or bicycles are at least 10 feet away.

column2: 23. Before turning left, it is important to:
column4: yield to oncoming vehicles.
column6: swing to the right side of your lane.
column8: flash your headlights to alert the other drivers.
column10: sound your horn to warn the other drivers.

column2: 24. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Try to fight the fire yourself.
column6: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.
column8: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.
column10: Jump off your car immediately, if it is safe to do so.

column2: 25. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.
column6: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column8: Pull the steering wheel back.
column10: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
